page.title: 13RACAL MARINE
page.content: {Racal Marine}is a member of the Racal Group which deals in elect- ronics. The factory we visited produced marine radar equipment for commercial use. We first visited the 'goods inwards' department where all the component parts arrive at the factory and are logged into a filing system. These parts are then tested to check that they are not faulty. The largest part of the factory is the production de- partment where the radars are assembled.The marine radars are not mass-produced but made in batches. The factory employs about 600 people on site,including people on the Youth Training Scheme and the Disabled. The hours of work are 8am to 4.30pm with overtime until 6.30pm.They have a 10 minute break halfway through the morning with half-an-hour for lunch.
